title: What did the reference to dream weaver mean to John Lennon in his song entitled God? - Quora

response.answer_text: A weaver of dreams would be telling imaginary tales and journeys through imaginary dreamscapes. It would be a pretty nice way of describing a songwriter that deals with far-out concepts. And John did of course, especially in his Psychedelic phase. In God he is closing every preceding chapter of his life to move on, part of the therapy he was going through. Hence, he was the dream weaver, but now he’s reborn. No more dreams, time for realities.

Who knows really. The beauty of poetry is often what it stimulates by leaving things open to interpretation. Perhaps he meant identification with Vishnu the cosmic dreamer. That's fun, but like anything it wears out. Perhaps he meant himself, as the projector of imagination, past, future, etc. He gives a list of things he doesn't believe in, which most people would call real. But if you were to look around you, none of those things actually exist. They are mental re-creations or images. You remember in the matrix how the false reality got piped in with symbols and glyphs?  This is not a pipe
